title: ‘Plaza Suite’ Review: Entertainment Checks Out
sub_head: Even Matthew Broderick and Sarah Jessica Parker can’t rescue Neil Simon’s 1968 comedy from its own fustiness.
body:
New York
Side-splitting? Not so much. Rib-tickling? Sporadically, depending on the sensitivity of your ribs. But the double-barreled adjective that best describes the highly anticipated revival of Neil Simon’s “Plaza Suite,” starring Matthew Broderick and Sarah Jessica Parker, is probably patience-trying.
